poem:
"A Sanctuary in Sloth"

In the languid bloom of six decades,
Mocking himself peeling off the age,
Man, now smug, bears a phantom weight.
Thirtieth mile's promise, kissed by strain,
Over the yogic chants, whispering of Sisyphus.
Truth, high-intensity, Unkind. God's mirth in a burn.
To outpace time, a folly of the flesh,
Yet delightfully human, this want to endure.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Never write yourself off! 25 things I’ve learned about getting fit – after almost 60 years of sloth There’s no getting away from it: I come across as smug. In March, kicking off what I hope will be a very long series of articles, I wrote that I was in “great shape” for a 60-year-old, with plans to make it to 100. I ran 30-40km every week, I added, on top of yoga and high-intensity". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
